'Eat well and go to sleep': Surya, Agha sidestep handshake chatter pre India-Pakistan WC clash
description: Captains Suryakumar Yadav and Salman Ali Agha remained non-committal on whether India and Pakistan players would shake hands before or after their T20 World Cup clash. Both leaders suggested waiting until match day for a decision, emphasizing their focus on playing good cricket. This follows a history where India did not shake hands with Pakistan in previous encounters.

Russia killed opposition leader Navalny using dart frog toxin, 5 European nations say
description: Five European nations confirmed Alexei Navalny was poisoned with a lethal toxin, accusing the Russian state. Laboratory analysis detected epibatidine, a powerful poison not naturally found in Russia. The countries will report Moscow to the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons for an alleged breach of the Chemical Weapons Convention.

description: Nepal had earlier pushed two-time champions England in a high-scoring match but failed to carry that performance forward. Against tournament debutants Italy, they were beaten without taking a wicket.

title: 'Move on' – How BCCI nudged Dhoni to quit captaincy and hand over to Kohli
description: The BCCI selection committee initiated the captaincy change from MS Dhoni to Virat Kohli in 2017.  Former selector Jatin Paranjpe revealed Dhoni accepted the decision respectfully.  Dhoni assured full support to Kohli, offering his experience.  This transition occurred after Dhoni had already achieved significant white-ball success for India.

Anthropic CEO tells US govt 'not to do' what Nvidia CEO has been 'begging' for
description: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei strongly opposes selling advanced AI chips to China, viewing them as a national security risk. He argues that while AI's economic benefits should be shared globally, critical compute power must remain out of authoritarian hands. Amodei believes this approach is crucial for maintaining global stability and preventing misuse of AI technology.

title: 'Girls, djinn rituals': Arrested ‘occultist’ modus operandi emerges in Delhi triple murder probe
‘Half-burnt body stuffed in suitcase’: Man kills woman, then gets her tattooed on his chest in Punjab
description: Bathinda Police have arrested Prince Kumar for the murder of his friend, Sapna, also known as Malika. Kumar confessed to killing Malika over a dispute on February 9th and subsequently attempting to dispose of her half-burnt body. The victim's remains were discovered stuffed in a suitcase in fields near Behman Diwana village.

title: Team Canada rules out Brad Marchand, Josh Morrissey vs Switzerland
description: Team Canada faces Switzerland at the 2026 Winter Olympics without key players Josh Morrissey and Brad Marchand. Morrissey is sidelined with an undisclosed injury sustained against Czechia, while Marchand's absence remains unexplained. Seth Jarvis is set to make his Olympic debut, replacing Morrissey on the third line, with Travis Sanheim also stepping into the lineup.

title: With no dowry case in a decade, Bihar’s Tharu community rewrites social norms
description: In the vibrant Tharu villages near Gobarhiya police station, a remarkable shift has taken place—dowry practices have been dismantled thanks to a community-driven cultural renaissance. Driven by the belief that true marriage transcends monetary exchanges, local leaders champion a return to traditional values, deeming dowry as an affront to their heritage.

title: Candace Owens calls claims about Erika Kirk 'absolutely vile'
description: A viral post has intensified debate over Candace Owens’ use of the term grooming in reference to a 15 year old. Critic Natly Denise accused Owens of exaggerating the situation, while Owens cited details from her own interview describing limited in person contact and online messages. The clash highlights ongoing tensions over how serious terms are defined and used in public commentary.

title: Cisco president Jeetu Patel says company will never hire these developers
description: Cisco's president Jeetu Patel mandates AI for all developers, aiming for half a dozen AI-coded products by 2026. This shift to spec-driven development sees human teams shrink, with AI agents tripling output. While embracing AI's potential, Cisco is investing heavily in security to prevent rogue agents, urging developers to master AI to stay relevant.

title: Whose road is it anyway?
description: What urban roads teach us about power, space, and who gets to claim them

title: Learning from failures
description: Achievement brings joy and fulfilment, but there is profound growth in learning to live through disappointment

title: Is it okay to be ambitious?
description: Yes, if it’s about achieving results, and not about status, wealth, and glory

title: After CEO asked employees to stop coding, Nvidia engineers get access to OpenAI's Codex
description: Nvidia has deployed OpenAI's Codex AI coding tool to all 30,000 engineers, marking a significant enterprise rollout. CEO Jensen Huang's mandate to automate tasks with AI is driving this adoption, with engineers praising the tool's ability to handle complex workflows and maintain context.

title: The Hall-mark on diamond
description: The centuries-long quest for synthetic diamonds, also known as lab-grown diamonds or human-made diamonds, came to an end in 1954-55. On February 15, 1955, the creation of the first synthetic diamonds were announced, and it was quickly picked-up by newspapers around the world. A.S.Ganesh tells you more about these diamonds and the man who first made it happen…
